Name: Kelly Young
Description:
Kelly was found shot at her home in East Baltimore. She died in hospital.
>
> BALTIMORE (WJZ) — Loved ones are looking for answers after a transgender woman was shot to death in East Baltimore. At this point, police say it’s too early to call it a hate crime.
>
> Family members are devastated. They say she had not reported any threats or anything unusual before she died.
> 
> Police say 29-year-old [deadname], who identifies as Kelly Young, was shot in a home in the 2200-block of Barclay Street early Wednesday morning. She was found on the floor suffering from a gunshot >wound and transported to a local hospital, where she was pronounced dead.
>
> A memorial of balloons now blows in the wind off Pennsylvania Avenue near where Kelly Young grew up. It’s a painful reminder of her loss.
>
> Another balloon is attached to a home about two miles away on Barclay and 22nd streets, where she was shot dead.
> 
> “Everyone around here loved her. I loved her. Last time I talked to my cousin, last thing I said to her was ‘Kelly, I love you. Be careful,'” said Secquoia Archer, victim’s cousin.

TvT project: ABC 2 News 04.04.2013 & CBS Baltimore 05.04.13

https://www.washingtonblade.com/2013/04/10/trans-woman-killed-in-baltimore/

https://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/04/05/baltimore-city-police-investigating-murder-of-transgender-woman/

https://www.cbsnews.com/news/transgender-womans-murder-has-community-on-edge-in-baltimore/

Name: Ashley Sinclair ("Mahogany Singleton")
Description:
Ashley was found shot dead in a wooded area of Orange County.

Ashley was known by the stage name Mahogany Singleton and was popular in the local LGBT community for her performances. 

> A transgender woman was found shot to death Thursday morning in a wooded area in the Oak Ridge area of Orange County.
>
> Investigators did not immediately release much information, but did identify the victim as 30-year-old Ashley Sinclair.
>
> Deputies spent Thursday morning in the woods along Rio Grande Avenue, where the victim was found after a 911 call came from neighbors just before 6 a.m. saying shots were fired in the area of the 1600 block of Nimrod Lane.
>
> A neighbor said they saw a black sedan pull up and then heard four shots fired.

In December 2014 Kentz Vernes Louis, 22, was convicted of manslaughter with a firearm and sentenced to 30 years in prison.

> Ashley Sinclair's killing didn't attract the attention of Central Florida's highest-profile homicides. But Thursday, friends and family made sure her killer knew the impact of the slaying.
>
> "When you took Ashley away from us, you hit us in the very core of our heart," said Axavier Darnell Strick, entertainment director for Parliament House, the gay entertainment venue where the 30-year-old transgender woman was a performer.
>
> "She was somebody who was important," Strick said. "She was somebody who was valued, and she was my friend... You took someone away from this community, and it mattered."
>
> The victim's mother, Angela Smith, was defiant.
>
> "You took my child, but you didn't break me," Smith told 23-year-old Kentz Vernes Louis. "You can't break me."
>
> Louis, convicted of manslaughter with a firearm in Sinclair's death at trial, was sentenced to 30 years in prison Thursday.

> Darcel Stevens, entertainment director for the Parliament House, and other friends of Sinclair filled the courtroom to hear Louis’ verdict. Stevens, who performs in drag, said he’s been friends with Sinclair for 12 or 13 years. He called their group “a sisterhood” and said “when something happens to one of us it affects us all.”
> 
> “Most of the entertainers aren’t drag queens like myself who live as a man and perform professionally as a female,” Stevens said. “Most are transsexual and live their truth. They aren’t 5’4” and don’t blend in easily. We stick together very tightly because there are people out there who don’t care very much for what we do and who we represent.”

TvT project: CF News, 05.04.2013

Name: Ángel Francisco Ramírez González
Description:
Angel was found by her relatives inside her beauty salon. Her body had several bruises and she had a gunshot wound to the head.

> UADALAJARA, JALISCO (11 / APR / 2013) .- Thrown and wrapped in a towel was found a dead [woman] in a salon located in the La Perla neighborhood of the municipality of Guadalajara. 
>
> Ar around 23:00 on Wednesday elements of the Municipal Police of Guadalajara were asked for their help to enter the salon on Abascal and Sousa Street at the intersection with Pablo Valdez. Upon arrival, officers along with relatives of Ángel Francisco Martínez González, 39, entered the premises. 
 >
> After inspecting the establishment, [deadname] González was located lying face down and dead, next to the bathroom door. She died of a bullet to the head and her body also had traces of blows.
> 
> A Guadalajara Police commander explained that the victim wore only a wrapped towel that covered her from the waist down. 

TvT partner organization: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans informador.com.mx 11.04.2013

Name: Débora Moreira Mori
Description:
Débora was a hairdresser who worked from a salon in her home. She was found dead there with her hands tied behind her back and with a stab wound to her neck by an employee who also saw two young men leave the house. She then called the police.

Her killers took jewelry, cell phones and money. One of them, a minor, was apprehended near the house. He had already robbed a pharmacy that morning.

Name: F. Domingues Rosa
Description:
F. was found dead on her bed by neighbours. She had been stabbed 3 times.

> A [trans woman] was found dead in her house yesterday afternoon in the Bela Vista 2 neighborhood of Rio Preto. The body of [deadname] Domingues Rosa, 36, was found by neighbors who called the military police. According to investigators the body was on the bed and had three knife wounds: the left eye, the right side of the neck and also the right shoulder. Police suspect it may be a crime of passion. “Nothing was taken from the victim's house. It could have been some boyfriend disagreement,” said Police Officer Mauro Truzzi. 

Housewife Eliana Cristina Ferreira da Silva, 29, said another neighbor commented that she heard a cry for help on Sunday night. “He couldn't tell what time it was. Around noon (yesterday) I went with my neighbor Marissa to her house and we found everything overturned, a lot of blood and she was dead. ” 

In August 2018 Daniel da Silva Dellamora, 25, was convicted of her murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison.

TvT project: TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia
TvT partner organization: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans www.diarioweb.com.br 30.04.2013
